intro: Randia pringlei subsp. viridifolia, commonly known as the green-leaved randia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its elliptical, glossy green leaves that are often tinged with yellow on the underside. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by red, fleshy berries. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
